Hi,

Some help would be appreciated.
Thanks.

Posts.EditableText:
Hi there not sure if you ticked the Map Feature in Game tab but if not go to Game tab then find Feature tab, from there find the clickable box Map then tick it so the check mark is there. Then should work if not im not sure from there.

Hope it helps 
Mike
Posts.HTML:

Thats weird on version 5.6.2 it was working updated to 5.6.3 yesterday just tried it and not working so its more then likely a bug that needs reporting. If you really want the map try the previous version of Quest.

Mike

Posts.EditableText:
Hey.  I'm having a different problem with the map/drawing grid.  Well, two problems I guess. 

First, when I display a picture in the picture frame, the map option goes wonky -- the picture won't "float" and effectively the room text gets lost.   Only by removing the map can it display a picture AND text.  (I tried resizing the map to a very small size but even that didn't work)

Second, and this may or may not be a glitch, but if at some point in the game I want to run a turn script moving the player to another location, the map function no longer works.   There is no way of knowing where the player will be located when the turn script triggers, so I can't move player through every rooms in sequential order to get to the desired location (which I guess the map would tolerate).  

Any thoughts?
Posts.HTML:
Hey. I'm having a different problem with the map/drawing grid. Well, two problems I guess.

First, when I display a picture in the picture frame, the map option goes wonky -- the picture won't "float" and effectively the room text gets lost. Only by removing the map can it display a picture AND text. (I tried resizing the map to a very small size but even that didn't work)

Second, and this may or may not be a glitch, but if at some point in the game I want to run a turn script moving the player to another location, the map function no longer works. There is no way of knowing where the player will be located when the turn script triggers, so I can't move player through every rooms in sequential order to get to the desired location (which I guess the map would tolerate).

Any thoughts?
